intro: Sphaerotele coccinea, commonly known as the red globular liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form composed of small, rounded thalli. The plant features a distinctive red or orange coloration due to the presence of carotenoids in its cells. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Sphaerotele coccinea plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
